no.patternsolutions.javann
Class Hebb

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      no.patternsolutions.javann.NeuralNet
          no.patternsolutions.javann.Hebb
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Hebb
extends NeuralNet

A simple neural net for linear separable problems. Uses the hebbian learning rule and bipolar data to train the network in only 1 iteration.

See Also:
Serialized Form

randomizeWeights

public void randomizeWeights(double from,
                             double to)
Enables the weights to be initially set as random values between from and to. from <= X < to. Default is from -1.0 to 1.0.

Parameters:
from - minimum value of the weights
to - maximum value of the weights

a table of output nodes.

setBiasEnabled

public void setBiasEnabled(boolean enabled)
Toggles the use of bias. Default is true.

Parameters:
enabled - true if the bias is on. False if bias is off.

setIterations

public void setIterations(int value)
This method does not work in Hebb, because Hebb always learns in only one iteration.

Overrides:
setIterations in class NeuralNet
Parameters:
value - The number of iterations you want to set, but it will always be set to 1.

setWeightsInit

public void setWeightsInit(double value)
Sets the initial value of the weights to value. The weigts will get this value if the network is not yet trained or if reset() is runned.

Parameters:
value - the initial value of all the weights.
See Also:
reset()

trainPatterns

public void trainPatterns(int[][] inputs,
                          int[][] answers)
Trains a set of patterns in 1 iteration.

Parameters:
inputs - a table of the input patterns.
answers - a table of the answers.
